intro: Rubus foliosus var. monticola, commonly known as the mountain raspberry. It is a shrub native to the mountainous regions of western North America, characterized by its upright growth habit and thorny stems. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits that are typically red or orange in color, often appearing in late summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three leaflets that are serrated along the edges. The species is adapted to rocky and well-drained soils, often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
